clinical_study.brief_title: The Perioperative Pain Self-Management Program Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Chronic Post-Surgical Pain and Prolonged Opioid Use: The Perioperative Pain Self-Management Program

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: This study will trial the impact of teaching surgical patients a pain self-management approach to compliment medical post-surgical pain management.

detailed_description.textblock: Surgery can precipitate the development of both chronic pain and long-term opioid use. There is a need for strategies to augment perioperative pharmacotherapeutic management of pain with non-pharmacologic strategies to prevent long-term sequelae. Psychological interventions such as cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) can effectively reduce distress and improve functioning among patients with chronic pain. While CBT has been used extensively in patients with established chronic pain, it has not been used as a preventive intervention targeting the transition from acute to chronic postsurgical pain. The Perioperative Pain Self-management (PePS) program has the potential to reduce the incidence of chronic post-surgical pain and long-term opioid use among Veterans. This study will: Examine the efficacy of PePS compared to standard care on 6-month pain (primary outcome), mood and functioning outcomes as well as time to post-surgical opioid and other analgesic use cessation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomized to either receive the pain self-management sessions (PePS) or standard care (SC).
study_design_info.masking_description: The outcomes assessor will be blinded to randomization status.

primary_outcome.description: Surgical Site Pain The Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) is a 0-10 measure where 0 = no pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time to cessation post surgery (weekly phone calls for the first 6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to opioid cessation following surgery: daily opioid use will be collected via weekly phone calls for the first 6 weeks post-surgery.

other_outcome.description: A measure of depressive symptoms. Scores range from 0-24 with higher scores indicating more depressive symptoms.
A measure of anxious symptoms. Scores range from 0-21 with higher scores indicating more anxious symptoms.
A measure of pain-related functioning. Scores range from 0-70 with higher scores indicating greater pain-related disability.
Generalized body pain intensity and pain interference. Scores range from 0-10 with higher scores indicating more pain severity and interference.

other_outcome.time_frame: time to cessation post-surgery (weekly phone calls for the first 6 weeks post-surgery)
other_outcome.description: Time to cessation of other analgesics following surgery: daily analgesic use will be collected via weekly phone calls for the first 6 weeks post-surgery.

arm_group.description: 4 sessions of telephone CBT-based pain self-management in addition to standard perioperative care.

intervention.description: 4 sessions of telephone CBT-based pain self-management.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled for total hip, knee, or shoulder joint arthroplasty through the VA
Exclusion Criteria:
- inability to complete study forms/procedures because of a language/literacy barrier
- active bipolar or psychotic disorder
- history of brain injury
- dementia
- CBT therapy within the past year
- lack of access to a telephone for PePS sessions
